result.execSummary:
The defendant Linda A Korth was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft - County Ordinance. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid at $25.00 per month commencing 11/16/16 and each month thereafter or penalty of 6 days jail, consecutive, for non-payment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Linda A Korth

Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on: 6/30/16 and 7/5/16.
Court trial on August 12, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Linda A Korth in court with attorney Samuel W. Benedict.  Melissa J. Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The parties advise the Court they are ready to proceed to trial.  Attorney Benedict waives his right to a jury trial . The Court addresses the motion to file an amended information. Attorney Zilavy requests the Court grant the motion to file the amended complaint.  Attorney Benedict objects to the motion for reasons stated on the record. The Court denies the motion for reasons stated on the record.  The State does not object to the waiver of the jury trial.  The Court grants the waiver of jury trial and sets the matter for a court trial.  Court trial scheduled for August 12, 2016 at 10:00 am.
